biogHists.text:
At the end of World War II, the Hungarian Crown guard transferred the Crown of St. Stephen, a symbol of the Hungarian nation, to U.S. Army officers to prevent the Crown from falling into the hands of the Soviet army. Later, Cold War tensions prevented the crown from being returned to the Hungarian people. In 1978, the Crown was returned to Hungary by order of President Jimmy Carter.

From the description of Documents from the Carter Presidential Papers White House Central File, [manuscript] [1977-1981] / Jimmy Carter Library. (Indiana University). WorldCat record id: 700265232 From the description of Documents related to the Crown of St. Stephen, [manuscript] [1977-1981] / Jimmy Carter Library. (Indiana University). WorldCat record id: 700267591

relations.content: United States. Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs.

                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:700265232</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-IUL</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Jimmy Carter Library.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>United States. President (1977-1981 : Carter)</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Documents from the Carter Presidential Papers White House Central File, [manuscript] [1977-1981] / Jimmy Carter Library.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Documents are photocopied from the Carter Presidential Papers, White House Central File. Documents include correspondence, memorandums, telegrams, and newspaper clippings pertaining to the return of the Crown of St. Stephen to Hungary. Some documents have been declassified. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Indiana University</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>An interview with Frederick C. Smith / Frederick C. Smith ; Mark R. DePue, interviewer. 2010.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>An interview of Frederick C. Smith conducted by Mark R. DePue for the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library. Topics discussed include National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) Presidential Libraries and Museums; Herbert Hoover Presidential Library and Museum; Harry S. Truman Library and Museum; John F. Kennedy Library and Museum; Lyndon B. Johnson Library and Museum; Richard M. Nixon Library and Museum; Gerald Ford Library and Museum; Jimmy Carter Library and Museum; Ronald Reagan Library and Museum; George H.W. Bush Library and Museum; and William J. Clinton Library and Museum. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:173863206</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:GEU-S</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>CAUTION, Inc.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>CAUTION, Inc. records, 1982-1986.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>The collection consists of records of CAUTION, Inc. (Coalition Against Unnecessary Thoroughfares in Our Neighborhood) from 1982-1986. The records include correspondence, legal documents, traffic observations, photographs, diagrams, maps and drawings relating to CAUTION's fight against the parkway leading to the Jimmy Carter Library (Atlanta, Ga.). </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Unknown</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
